core:description.@value: Welcome to the **Mule Template API** Documentation. The Mule Template API allows you to connect your application to some simple endpoints that illustrate the design of a Web-based API.
The greetings resource contains only a simple message. The message text might be customized by passing a query parameter.
Answers a collection of three simple greetings.
The ID of the representation, a randomly generated UUID.
The text of the message.
Holds the collection of simple messages.
Describes a collection of 0..n simple message representations consisting of an ID and a text.

data:value.@value: Enjoy this wonderful day while the sun is shining on the autumn leaves.
Can you hear the waves? Most amazing sound I've ever heard.
Mindfulness is one of the secrets for a happy life.

core:description.@value: The response does not contain any content.
This API supports Basic Authentication. The client has to provide an "Authorization" header with valid credentials.
Used to send valid credentials.
Used to send valid credentials.
Credentials are missing or could not be validated by the server.
Creates a representation of a simple greeting message. This is a pseudo operation, the API does not store the representation in any way.
The ID of the representation, a randomly generated UUID.
The text message of the greeting.
Describes simple greeting representation consisting of an ID and a message.

data:value.@value: Welcome and thanks for your request, mike.

core:description.@value: The ID of the representation, a randomly generated UUID.
The text message of the greeting.
Describes simple greeting representation consisting of an ID and a message.

data:value.@value: Welcome and thanks for your request, mike.

core:description.@value: This API supports Basic Authentication. The client has to provide an "Authorization" header with valid credentials.
Used to send valid credentials.
Used to send valid credentials.
Credentials are missing or could not be validated by the server.
Responds with a greeting a for the given 'name'.
Answers a greeting representation for the given 'name'.
Pass a message which should be used by the response.
Pass a message which should be used by the response.
The ID of the representation, a randomly generated UUID.
The text message of the greeting.
Describes simple greeting representation consisting of an ID and a message.

data:value.@value: Welcome and thanks for your request, mike.

core:description.@value: This API supports Basic Authentication. The client has to provide an "Authorization" header with valid credentials.
Used to send valid credentials.
Used to send valid credentials.
Credentials are missing or could not be validated by the server.
The companies resource is probably the most simple representation of a C&A company.
Answers a collection (1..n) of all available Companies with their basic attributes.
The code of the given company is the unique identifier of the entity.
The legal name of the given company.
Describes the probably most simple representation of a CANDA company.

data:value.@value: C & A Mode GmbH & Co. KG, Germany

core:description.@value: The response does not contain any content.
This API supports Basic Authentication. The client has to provide an "Authorization" header with valid credentials.
Used to send valid credentials.
Used to send valid credentials.
Credentials are missing or could not be validated by the server.
The additions resource consists of the elements of a mathematical addition - a result and the summands.
Answers a simple JSON response that reflects the elements of an addition.
Pass the list of summands separated by ',' (comma). Each summand must be a value between 0 and 99999. The value must not contain spaces.
Pass the list of summands separated by ',' (comma). Each summand must be a value between 0 and 99999. The value must not contain spaces.
The result (sum) of the addition.
The integer value of the summand.
Describes the representation of an addition with 1..n summands.
This API supports Basic Authentication. The client has to provide an "Authorization" header with valid credentials.
Used to send valid credentials.
Used to send valid credentials.
Credentials are missing or could not be validated by the server.
Change the severity of a specific logger.
The new log level to be set.
Optional parameter to create a logger in case it does not exist (to avoid typo errors for existing loggers).
Delay in hours after which time the logger is set back to its original log level.
the human readable result of the changeLogLevel operation.

Add
"#[com.canda.mulestac.logging.ChangeLogLevel.changeWithJson(flowVars.loggerName, payload)]"
to your generated set-payload flow element.

data:value.@value: TODO you need to replace this generated setpayload by #[com.canda.mulestac.logging.ChangeLogLevel.changeWithJson(flowVars.loggerName, payload)] in the api.xml

doc:usage.@value: This library defines some common concepts to be used throughout C&A's API specifications.
